text: hello everyone my name is Robin and in
this video I'm going to talk about the
konglish term mt now the first time I
heard mt was long ago probably around 13
years ago yes I've been in Korea a long
time I was teaching an adult class and
there was some University students in
the class and I asked one of the
students what are they doing on the
weekend and he told me he's going on an
mt and I was like Mt what is an mt and
he said oh he knew I didn't understand
so he explained mt means membership
training and he said membership training
to me and I was like I still don't
understand you know I don't understand
Mt and I don't understand membership
training so what is that so he explained
to me what they were doing and then I'm
like ah you're going on a school trip or
you're going on a workshop ok so mt is
definitely konglish you can't say it in
English to a native English speaker they
won't understand alright so let's take a
look at my examples so i have this is
what he should have said and i would
have understood so he should have said
the first one we will go on a school
trip soon ok so on the weekend we'll go
on a school trip alright and i would
probably under understand a little bit
better if he said the university trip or
college trip they're going on a trip or
he could have said we will go to a
workshop if he said we will go to a
workshop or a university workshop i
would understand all right but i'm not
going to understand mt or membership
training probably the best way to
describe an empty is i'm going with my
school friends to go out drinking for
the weekend that's probably the best way
to describe it but these ones
will do recently mt also has another
meaning so I talked to my students and
they often say mt not to mean membership
training but to mean motel it's kind of
a jokingly with a joking way to say
motel because mow em tell t they say mt
again this is not used in English if
you're talking in English to a native
speaker and you say mt to mean motel
they won't understand okay so you have
to say motel for them to understand
alright so that's mt be careful using it
it is konglish you should say a school
trip or workshop and if you're talking
about the motel just say motel that's it
and I'll see you next time
